repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits.

summary.p: The manuscript contains the commentary by Nacciṉārkkiṉiyar, designated as tirumurukāṟṟuppaṭaiyurai (U3, lm). The root-text is quoted by smaller bits, which are followed by relevant commentary consisiting in paraphrase and explanations on the meaning and grammatical analysis.

The Tirumurukāṟṟuppaṭai is a devotional poem, dated possibly to the 7th century of the Common Era, in praise of the Tamil god Murukaṉ. The poem, attributed to Nakkīrar, belongs to the Caṅkam corpus and to the Tamil Śaiva canonical works (Tirumuṟai).
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (November 2011, July 2020, January 2023).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination (January 2023).

supportDesc.condition: Relatively good state of preservation, in spite of boreholes caused by insects.

additions.p: Marginal benedictions; title-page; marginal chapter headers (original ones crossed-out, while others, later added, are not blackened with soot); colophon; ownership statement; addenda: benedictions (U1, f[1]r, rm); 1 Kampar taṉippāṭal (U5: f[1]r).

Shelfmark c/22 written in black ink (f[1]r).

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF. 370 x 30 mm.

origin.origDate: Internally dated to Saturday 22 of the month cittirai of the year cupāṉu of the Jovian cycle, that is, CE 1823-1824, 1763-1764, 1703-1704, etc. See colophon U3, f36r4. Dated to 1763 by Vinson (1868) on the basis of the colophon. Not dated by Cabaton (1912). Not after 1855, as it is part of Ariel’s bequest made in that year to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868). ― The date appears to correspond to Saturday May 3rd, 1823, as assessed by Giovanni Ciotti and Marco Franceschini.

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequeathed by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192. Legs d'Édouard Ariel.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
